title: Optimized Custom CNN for Real-Time Tomato Leaf Disease Detection
author: Mangsura Kabir Oni (Jahangirnagar University), Tabia Tanzin Prama (Jahangirnagar University), ...
relevance_why: The use of deep learning techniques for detecting agricultural diseases showcases methods that can potentially enhance the efficiency of audio data analysis in future applications.
background: The paper discusses a system designed for detecting diseases in tomato leaves using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to automate and improve traditional visual inspection methods.
contribution: This study introduces an optimized custom Convolutional Neural Network model to solve the challenge of accurately detecting tomato leaf diseases, achieving an accuracy of 95.2%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models like YOLOv5 and MobileNetV2 achieved lower accuracy rates of 77% and 89.38% respectively.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work's custom CNN is tailored specifically for tomato leaf disease detection, enhancing both accuracy and computational efficiency compared to existing architectures.

key_innovation: The model employs a tailored CNN architecture designed for robust performance in real-world agricultural settings, integrating advanced data preprocessing and augmentation techniques.
real_world_impact: By improving disease detection in tomatoes, this technology can support farmers in enhancing crop yield and efficiency, contributing to agricultural sustainability.
limitations: No explicit limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Convolutional Neural Network (CNN): **Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)** is a type of deep learning model particularly effective at processing structured grid data like images, using convolutional layers to extract features.
new_terms.data augmentation: **Data augmentation** refers to techniques used to artificially expand the training dataset by applying transformations that generate new data samples from existing data.
